intro: Tetramerium ochoterenae, commonly known as the Ochoterenae tetramerium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhizophoraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in mangrove or brackish water habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
